definition: to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: This backdoor run is forcing banks to sell assets and squeeze lending;
sentences.chinese: 這個挖牆腳的行爲使銀行出售資產並壓縮貸款。

sentences.english: Everybody tries to mend the walls.
sentences.chinese: 人人都補牆，不會挖牆腳。

sentences.english: Nobody wants to damage the walls or split the house.
sentences.chinese: 誰也不想禍起蕭牆，自挖牆腳。

definition: to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
